org.jaudiolibs.audioservers
Interface AudioServer

All Known Implementing Classes:
JackAudioServer, JavasoundAudioServer
public interface AudioServer

A base interface for classes providing a server to run AudioClients. It is up to implementations how the AudioClient is connected to the server - this will usually happen at creation time. AudioServers provide a run() method as it is intended that the application should provide the Thread in which the server will run, however they do not extend Runnable as the run() method throws an Exception, forcing the application to deal with any problems starting the server.

Method Summary
 AudioConfiguration getAudioContext()
          Get the current AudioConfiguration.
 boolean isActive()
          Check whether the server is active.
 void run()
          Start and run the audio server in the current thread.
 void shutdown()
          Trigger the server to shut down.
 

Method Detail

run

void run()
         throws java.lang.Exception
Start and run the audio server in the current thread.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getAudioContext

AudioConfiguration getAudioContext()
Get the current AudioConfiguration. This value should remain constant while the server is processing audio.

Returns:
AudioConfiguration

isActive

boolean isActive()
Check whether the server is active. This method can be called from another thread.

Returns:
true if active.

shutdown

void shutdown()
Trigger the server to shut down. This method can be called from another thread, but does not guarantee that the server is shut down at the moment it returns.
